lines.content: * This class represents a specific command of adding a task to Duke.
* This constructor loads the entire input command into the object for further processing of its details, such as type
* of task added and other details (e.g. description and time).

* containing details about the task for the task to be created.

* @exception DukeException is thrown when there is an error with the input
* @exception IOException is thrown when there is an error saving the data in the hard disk
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException, IOException {

* This abstract class of Command contains the methods execute(...) and isExit() which are implemented in its child
* classes, where each is a more specific command parsed from the inputs to Duke.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException, IOException;
* This class represents a specific command of deleting a task from Duke.
* This method removes the target task from the list and prompts the user the number of remaining tasks saved.
* @param tasks contains the data structure of Tasks stored in Duke
* @param ui contains methods dealing with interaction with the user
* @param storage contains methods to load and save information in the file
* @exception DukeException is thrown when there is an error with the input
* @exception IOException is thrown when there is an error saving the data in the hard disk
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException, IOException {
throw new DukeException("Oops! This task number does not exist.");
this.ui.printLine("Now you have " + maxNum + " tasks in the list.");
* This class represents a specific command of marking a task in Duke as done.
* This method marks the target task as done and prompts the user which task has been marked done.
* @param tasks contains the data structure of Tasks stored in Duke
* @param ui contains methods dealing with interaction with the user
* @param storage contains methods to load and save information in the file
* @exception DukeException is thrown when there is an error with the input
* @exception IOException is thrown when there is an error saving the data in the hard disk
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException, IOException {
throw new DukeException("Oops! This task number does not exist.");
this.ui.printLine("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* This class represents a specific command of exiting from Duke.
* This method prints the exit line from Duke and closes the chatbot.
* @param tasks contains the data structure of Tasks stored in Duke
* @param ui contains methods dealing with interaction with the user
* @param storage contains methods to load and save information in the file
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
this.ui.printLine("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* This class represents a specific command of listing tasks stored in Duke.

public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

* This exception is thrown when there is error in the input for dates and times regarding the Deadline and Event tasks.

* @exception DateException if the month number is invalid

* @param hours a String containing the hour number
* @exception DateException if the month number is invalid
private static String getHours(String hours) throws DateException {

* This method deals with loading tasks from the file and saving tasks in the file. It contains methods that process

* This method is called when Duke starts in order to load previously saved information on the hard disk.
* @exception DukeException is thrown when there is an error with the location where the information was stored
throw new DukeException("File not found. A new TaskList will be loaded.");
